children.subject: Hi! Is there a supplemental application to TA for this course?
Has the enrollment information been sent out to students who are admitted?

history.content:
Classes will be: Lecture 1: Wednesdays 5-7pm & Lecture 2: Thursdays 5pm-7pm   Here’s a link to the application: https://goo.gl/forms/aYbNmBweaHePyKuD2

CS370: "Adaptive Teaching Methods in Computer Science" application is officially open! CS370 is our equity-based CS pedagogy course that meets the course requirement for TAs to teach. It's a highly interactive class where you participate in building materials and resources to help you as a tutor, mentor, and TA--most of the material translates well to industry and academia too. Anyone who has attended Cal for one semester and isn't graduating is eligible to apply.

This course is 3 units and does require tutoring each week (1-3 hours per week depending on your potential course staff roles; most non-TAs complete 3 hours per week). The time difference between CS375 (our department's 2 unit course) and 370 is about an hour per week for TAs, and students thus far find it to be worthwhile.

We've received 200+ applications for several semesters so please apply as soon as you are able to reserve your seat. 

Classes will be: Lecture 1: Wednesdays 5-7pm & Lecture 2: Thursdays 5pm-7pm   Here’s a link to the application: https://goo.gl/forms/aYbNmBweaHePyKuD2

Our “Worthwhileness of Course” evals have ranged from 5.0-6.7/7.0 total. And our “Teaching Effectiveness" score has ranged from one 6.0 to 6.5/7.0. We consider ourselves fortunate to have solid ratings for a non-required course, and hope to see you join us!

Feel free to email cthunn@berkeley.edu with questions

PS Please also feel free to distribute this via relevant channels (Piazzas etc.), CS Mentors, and various lower-division classes if students are interested in being TAs, tutors, or mentors. Thanks!
